complaint_summary: The complaint alleged improper handling of witness cross-examinations and procedural irregularities in the trial court.
investigation_summary: The Magistrate denied allegations of threatening the accused and justified disallowing cross-examinations based on witness statements.
judgment_summary: The application for transfer was allowed due to procedural irregularities, including disallowance of cross-examinations and improper scheduling of witness testimonies.
Decision_or_verdict: Application allowed; case transferred to another court of competent jurisdiction.
legal_arguments: Disallowance of cross-examination of Noor Muhammad based on his inability to identify accused.
Disallowance of cross-examination of Mst. Allah Rakhi due to lack of identification parade application.
Objection to prosecution presenting evidence in instalments.
Defense objection regarding witness scheduling and alleged bias of Presiding Officer.

witness_statement.Mst. Allah Rakhi: Cross-examination disallowed due to lack of identification parade application.

legal_terms.Identification Parade: A procedure to identify suspects by witnesses.
legal_terms.Cross-examination: Questioning of a witness by the opposing party.

words_and_phrases.Transfer Application: Request to move a case to another court.
words_and_phrases.Competent Jurisdiction: A court legally authorized to hear the case.

summary_vector_notes: The case involved procedural irregularities in witness handling and scheduling, leading to the transfer of the case to another court. The judgment emphasized the importance of fair cross-examination and proper trial procedures.
